intro: Oeceoclades falcata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Southeast Asia. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and mountainous regions. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces delicate, greenish-yellow flowers with a distinctive, narrow shape. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its specialized root system that helps it absorb nutrients from the soil. Due to its habitat specificity, it is often found in areas with high humidity and moderate temperatures.
